pros: Flexible schedule, perfect part time job for students in smfa.
cons: Intensity of the job depends on other workers.

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Boston, MA
pros: Management was efficient and were accommodating to student's needs.  I never had an issue rescheduling shifts.
cons: They assistants are mostly student workers, so unless you had the qualifications it was hard if not impossible to change titles.

review_title: Nice place to work, but nobody's getting rich.
pros: It's a fairly casual environment; flexible schedules seem possible for many; interesting things happening sometimes, if you enjoy visual arts; LGBT friendly.
cons: Dismal salary; besides free museum admission there are no real perks, not even free coffee; faculty can be obnoxious; not much opportunity for advancement.

pros: The School of the Museum of Fine Arts was a great place to work.  The staff was friendly and professional.  I recommend working here.
cons: Frankly, I was quite happy while working at SMFA.  The only downfall was that my position was seasonal which made it difficult to schedule around.

review_title: Not as long as I would have liked it to have been
job_title: Cash Control Associate in Avon, MA
pros: Liked doing what I was hired for, liked working for the museum, had excellent rapport with my coworkers, and was making a good salary at the time

job_title: Media Stockroom Monitor in Boston, MA
pros: Allows you to become adept in knowledge about various forms of media equipment from photography, video, sound, and film.
cons: Management could have been a little better.

pros: Fun, easy, great public speaking opportunity
cons: Had to join through school program
